1.title: Welcome to ZOE
1.description: Let's start with some basic information about you.

core_questions.text: Full Name
Date of Birth
Email

2.title: Basic Profile
2.description: A few more details to personalize your assessment.

core_questions.text: Sex (Male/Female/Other)
Height
Weight
Overall sleep quality in past month (1=Very poor, 10=Excellent)

3.title: Sleep Quality Check
3.description: How has your sleep been lately?

core_questions.text: Hours of sleep per night (weeknight average)
How often do you feel refreshed after sleep? (Never/Rarely/Sometimes/Often/Always)

4.title: Sleep Difficulties

core_questions.text: Do you have trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or waking too early? (Yes/No)

4.trigger_note: If you report sleep difficulties, we'll ask some additional questions to better understand your situation.

trigger_question.text: Do you have trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or waking too early? (Yes/No)

questions.text: I need 8 hours of sleep to feel refreshed and function well during the day (0-10)
When I don't get the proper amount of sleep on a given night, I need to catch up on the next day by napping or sleeping longer (0-10)
I am concerned that chronic insomnia may have serious consequences on my physical health (0-10)
I am worried that I may lose control over my abilities to sleep (0-10)
After a poor night's sleep, I know that it will interfere with my daily activities on the next day (0-10)
In order to be alert and function well during the day, I believe I would be better off taking a sleeping pill rather than having a poor night's sleep (0-10)
When I feel irritable, depressed, or anxious during the day, it is mostly because I did not sleep well the night before (0-10)
When I sleep poorly on one night, I know it will disturb my sleep schedule for the whole week (0-10)
Without an adequate night's sleep, I can hardly function the next day (0-10)
I can't ever predict whether I'll have a good or poor night's sleep (0-10)
I have little ability to manage the negative consequences of disturbed sleep (0-10)
When I feel tired, have no energy, or just seem not to function well during the day, it is generally because I did not sleep well the night before (0-10)
I believe insomnia is essentially the result of a chemical imbalance (0-10)
I feel that insomnia is ruining my ability to enjoy life and prevents me from doing what I want (0-10)
Medication is probably the only solution to sleeplessness (0-10)
I avoid or cancel obligations (social, family) after a poor night's sleep (0-10)

5.title: Daytime Energy
5.description: How do you feel during the day?

core_questions.text: Do you feel excessively tired or sleepy during the day? (Never/Rarely/Sometimes/Often/Always)

5.trigger_note: Excessive daytime sleepiness may require deeper assessment.

trigger_question.text: Do you feel excessively tired or sleepy during the day? (Never/Rarely/Sometimes/Often/Always)

questions.text: Difficulty concentrating on things you read or do (1-4)
Difficulty remembering things (1-4)
Difficulty working on a hobby, for example, sewing, collecting, gardening, woodworking (1-4)
Difficulty getting things done because you felt tired or sleepy (1-4)
Difficulty being as active as you wanted to be in the evening (1-4)
Difficulty maintaining a telephone conversation (1-4)
Difficulty maintaining your desired level of intimacy with your partner (1-4)
Difficulty doing things for your family (1-4)
Difficulty visiting family or friends in their homes in the evening (1-4)
Difficulty being as active as you wanted to be socially (1-4)
My motivation is lower when I am fatigued (1-7)
Exercise brings on my fatigue (1-7)
I am easily fatigued (1-7)
Fatigue interferes with my physical functioning (1-7)
Fatigue causes frequent problems for me (1-7)
My fatigue prevents sustained physical functioning (1-7)
Fatigue interferes with carrying out certain duties and responsibilities (1-7)
Fatigue is among my three most disabling symptoms (1-7)
Fatigue interferes with my work, family, or social life (1-7)

6.title: Breathing & Sleep

core_questions.text: Do you snore loudly? (Yes/No)
Has anyone observed you stop breathing during sleep? (Yes/No)
Neck circumference (inches)

6.trigger_note: Snoring or breathing pauses during sleep are important indicators.

core_questions.text: In the past 2 weeks, have you felt down, depressed, or hopeless? (Not at all/Several days/More than half/Nearly every day)
In the past 2 weeks, have you felt nervous, anxious, or on edge? (Not at all/Several days/More than half/Nearly every day)

trigger_question.text: In the past 2 weeks, have you felt nervous, anxious, or on edge? (Not at all/Several days/More than half/Nearly every day)

questions.text: I found it hard to wind down (0-3)
I was aware of dryness of my mouth (0-3)
I couldn't seem to experience any positive feeling at all (0-3)
I experienced breathing difficulty (e.g., excessively rapid breathing, breathlessness) (0-3)
I found it difficult to work up the initiative to do things (0-3)
I tended to over-react to situations (0-3)
I experienced trembling (e.g., in the hands) (0-3)
I felt that I was using a lot of nervous energy (0-3)
I was worried about situations in which I might panic and make a fool of myself (0-3)
I felt that I had nothing to look forward to (0-3)
I found myself getting agitated (0-3)
I found it difficult to relax (0-3)
I felt down-hearted and blue (0-3)
I was intolerant of anything that kept me from getting on with what I was doing (0-3)
I felt I was close to panic (0-3)
I was unable to become enthusiastic about anything (0-3)
I felt I wasn't worth much as a person (0-3)
I felt that I was rather touchy (0-3)
I was aware of the action of my heart in the absence of physical exertion (0-3)
I felt scared without any good reason (0-3)
I felt that life was meaningless (0-3)

8.title: Sleep Environment
8.description: How your bedroom affects your sleep.

core_questions.text: Do you have pain that affects your sleep? (Yes/No)
If yes, pain severity on average (0-10)

trigger_question.text: If yes, pain severity on average (0-10)

core_questions.text: Do you experience memory problems, difficulty concentrating, or mental fog? (Yes/No)
Typical bedtime on work days (HH:MM)

Typical bedtime on free days (HH:MM)
Typical wake time on free days (HH:MM)
Do you exercise regularly? (Yes/No)

trigger_question.text: Typical wake time on free days (HH:MM)

core_questions.text: If yes, hours per week
Do you consume caffeine? (Yes/No)
If yes, time of last caffeinated beverage (HH:MM)
